intro: Paragramma banaensis, commonly known as the Banaensis Paragramma, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a thalloid structure, characterized by a leafy, flattened body that lacks true roots, stems, and leaves. It reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. Paragramma banaensis plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
